Description: Glazed composition trunkated cone beaker decorated with lotus and bud chain round base, main register ducks flying in anti-clockwise direction alternately heads pointing forward and backwards, above them band of squares and crosses, top register now broken, but some elements still survive. Modelling in low relief, crude in style, with background roughened and a darker shade of green. Base bears marks of setters
Curator's comments: Base flat, with four unglazed patches on outer rim where setters placed when object being fired

Parallels dated to the 3rd to 1st century BC (Nenna and Seif el-Din, 2000, Form T6.4; Nenna 2013, Fig. 6.4, T6.4b). Probably of 3rd century BC as per similar ware and decoration on bowl, rhyton and closed vase forms. Nenna, M.-D. 2013. Faience vessels and objects in Nicholson, P. T. (ed.) Working in Memphis: The production of faience at Roman period Kom Helul. London: Egypt Exploration Society: 106-132. Nenna, M.-D. and M. Seif el-Din. La vaisselle en faïece d’époque gréco- romaine. Études Alexandrines 4. Cairo: IFAO.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (FC.05)
